name: pgadmin
description: pgAdmin is a popular web-based GUI for managing PostgreSQL databases. It includes advanced tools to create, query, monitor, and maintain databases in a self-hosted or cloud environment.
features: Database management: Create, modify, and delete PostgreSQL databases with a graphical interface.
Query tool: Write and execute SQL queries with syntax highlighting, auto-completion, and result visualization.
Schema browser: Navigate database objects including tables, views, functions, and triggers in a hierarchical tree.
Visual query builder: Construct complex SQL queries using drag-and-drop interface without writing code.
Data editing: View and modify table data directly in spreadsheet-like grids with inline editing.
Backup and restore: Schedule and manage database backups with support for pg_dump and pg_restore.
User management: Administer database users, roles, and permissions through intuitive dialogs.
Performance monitoring: Track query execution, connection statistics, and server metrics in real-time.
Import and export: Transfer data between databases using CSV, JSON, and other formats.
Multi-server support: Manage multiple PostgreSQL instances from a single interface with connection profiles.
ERD visualization: Generate entity-relationship diagrams to understand database structure and relationships.
Extension management: Install and configure PostgreSQL extensions like PostGIS and pg_stat_statements.
